fields.summary: get-console-output throws InternalError for PV instances after migration

comments.body:
Has this ever worked after migration? I don't recall this being tested, so just want to know if this is a regression or something that has been the case for a while.

Also, is there a network issue or just the console output? The title/description mention reaching the instance, but there is no network output or info describing what exactly the failure looks like. Please add as much info as possible.

[~zhill], I went ahead and tried to reproduce the issue again, but looks like all the instances are accessible after migration. Could be a networking issue earlier perhaps? I do however still see the console output issue. I am not sure if it ever worked.

With EDGE there is definitely a window where networking to the instance will fail just after the instance is migrated and before eucanetd sees the instance on the new NC as indicated in the GNI xml, which is updated only after the CLC learns the instance is on the destination host. That window of time is typically < 20 sec and often only a few seconds, but is expected based on how the system is designed for migration right now.

For console-output, I suspect the issue is simply an empty console file on the destination NC. A new one gets created, but it will not have any content since the vm is already running and the old contents are not transferred from the source to the destination. [~shaon], can you try the console output after 1 minute or so after the migration is complete? If it works, but is empty, then the issue is likely the request going to the wrong NC but once the instance location is fully updated post-migration then the call should work. Objective of this test is to determine if it always fails after a migration or only for some limited time window directly following a migration but then starts working again.
[~vasya] to try and reproduce. The output from an instance that has no console output should be an empty string rather than an error.
[~dmitrii], what is the target release for this issue?

Saw this issue happening in 4.3.0 (QA Cloud) when an EBS backed instance became non-responsive, {code} # euca-get-console-output --region qa-admin@ i-FFC6A715 euca-get-console-output: error (InternalError): Error processing request: Cluster response includes _return=false:ClusterGetConsoleOutputResponseType:null:return=false:epoch=null:status=ERROR [root@g-19-12 ~]# 'i-FFC6A715', 'region': 'qa-admin@', 'url': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None} 2017-03-08 12:46:13,109 INFO Config finding global option default-region 2017-03-08
